intro: Psephellus dimitriewae, commonly known as the dimitriewa's sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its restricted habitat and threatened status, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
